text: Can I delete the HubSpot app after being published?

*Google Cloud Platform* :ring_buoy: 
I’m trying to connect our HubSpot database into google cloud platform but struggling with the setup. We have created a private app with all read permissions and tried connecting in GCP with the HubSpot (preview) connector but get an unknown error. Anyone managed to do it successfully? Any help or guidance would be appreciated, cant find anything online and HubSpot support refered me here

Hello!
I have a problem with the 'block' feature in Custom Workflow Actions, the API endpoint that should unblock execution is not working.
More information: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Can-t-unblock-Custom-Workflow-Action/td-p/855978>
Does anybody know what I'm doing wrong?

Hey all, Im just trying to make sense of refresh tokens and auth tokens right now with HubSpot. Ive never had an issue until recently with refresh tokens. We have a client who is integrated with our app, but their auth never returned a refresh token. Is this a configurable thing in HubSpot to not return refresh tokens?

I'm having an issue where I create a deal when customers visit the cart page, then if they go to checkout too quickly, it creates a duplicate deal because the first request to create a deal hasn't completed and the search API doesn't find the first deal. Is there some way to work around that?

Do the contact list/campaign apis (or any other apis) have the ability to do the following:
• associate an existing contact list with an existing campaign id  
• when creating a contact list associate it with an existing campaign id
• get the campaign ids a contact list is associate with (or the contact lists a campaign is associated with)
Thanks!
How can I get a connected app’s data using the API? Where can I find those fields?

hi y'all. Maybe someone knows how to get the data from a picture <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge_Base_2021/analyze-aggregate-email-performance.png?width=1130&name=analyze-aggregate-email-performance.png|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge_Base_2021/analyze-aggregate-email-p[…]ng?width=1130&name=analyze-aggregate-email-performance.png>
it seems I need to use GET /marketing-emails/v1/emails/with-statistics endpoint , but I cant figure out how to filter by date.
What about creating a spinner in the app, subscribe to deal creation with webhooks, and then only allow the user to proceed when the deal creation webhook has fired?

Hi there, I'm doing a object search and in the results looks like it's finding one record because that's what the total property says but I get nothing in the results array. What am I missing. The API doesn't really give me a good example on what to send in the request body. Any direction here is greatly appreciated.
Hello Danny, have you tried setting the limit to something more than 0? Try limit=10
Duh, thanks Kellen. This is my first time with this API and didn't think to try that. That worked.
I also modified my properties and i'm getting what i was expecting
You're welcome. Glad it was an easy fix.
Hi there, is there any API I can use to get meeting information according to use name/email/id?
It seems `GET*/crm/v3/objects/meetings*` is getting all meetings.

I haven’t tried it personally, but looking at the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/meetings|documentation for the Meetings API>, it looks like you should be able to get an individual meeting with:
`GET /crm/v3/objects/meetings/MEETING_ID_HERE`

Thanks for your reply! But I don't have the meeting id. The scenario is I want to display the meetings for the users which he/she is going to join. So I was wondering if there any API can provide meeting information via user's information?

You can use search endpoint
/crm/v3/objects/meetings/search
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
And add such filter
```"filters": [
      {
        "propertyName": "associations.contact",
        "operator": "EQ",
        "value": "123"
      }
    ]```

Ah, I’m sorry, that’s my mistake — I’d misread your previous message.

Unfortunately, I don’t know if I could give you a clean answer on that one. It’d seem like the “Search” endpoint found in the documentation I linked above would be the ticket, but that documentation is so vague that I don’t know if I could begin to tell you how to use it.

If you’re looking to get all calls for a particular contact, there’s a legacy endpoint called “<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/get-associations|Get associations for a CRM object>” that should allow you to get a contact’s activities, which would include meetings.
<@U04AQA0QM8E> search endpoint more powerful I think :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U04MDP049AP> You’re likely right! That’s probably the better place to start — the legacy endpoints are more of a “if absolutely nothing else does it” option.
